title: Type python, press enter. What happens?
description:
This talk discusses how the Python interpreter starts, from the
perspective of the operating system (OS). Together, we will see the ins
& outs of processes: fork(), exec(), stdin, and stdout.

It focuses on OS concepts and requires no background knowledge, using
analogies to Python data structures. (The talk does not discuss Python’s
own initialization, such as site.py or global variables.)
